content.text: From this list of numbers, write down
(c) Put one pair of brackets into this calculation to make it correct.
(d) Find the lowest common multiple (LCM) of 30 and 68.
(b) Find the value of \(c^{2}+d^{2}\) when \(c=7\) and \(d=-5\).
(i) Make \(m\) the subject of the formula.
(ii) Find the mass of a chicken that takes 83 minutes to cook.
(c) The time, \(T\) minutes, to cook a chicken with a mass of \(m \mathrm{~kg}\) is \(T=35 m+20\).
You must show all your working.
(a) Write down the mathematical name of quadrilateral \(A\).
(c) Describe fully the single transformation that maps
(d) On the grid, enlarge quadrilateral \(A\) by scale factor \(2, \text { centre }(-3,-3)\).
3 The diagram shows four quadrilaterals, \(A, B, C\) and \(D\), on a \(1 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\) grid.
4 (a) Anton records the number of pets owned by each of 50 families. The table shows some of his results.
There are twice as many families with 4 pets than with 5 pets.
(b) 80 of the pets owned by the families are cats, rabbits or hamsters.
The table shows the number of each pet.
(iii) One of the pets is chosen at random.
Find the probability that a rabbit is chosen.
(b) 80 of the pets owned by the families are cats, rabbits or hamsters. The table shows the number of each pet.

content.text: (i) Write down the mathematical name for the type of angle marked \(125^{\circ}\).
(ii) Give the geometrical reason why the value of \(x\) is 125 .
The diagram shows a pair of parallel lines and a straight line.
The diagram shows three straight lines.
Write down the geometrical properties needed to find the value of \(y\).
(i) Write down the mathematical name of the line \(C D E\).
Give a geometrical reason for your answer.
(d) Find the interior angle of a regular 15-sided polygon.
The diagram shows a circle, centre \(O\), with diameter \(A O B\). The line \(C D E\) touches the circle at \(D\) and angle \(D O B=74^{\circ}\).
6 (a) (i) Complete the table of values for \(y=-x^{2}+8 x+1\).
(ii) On the grid, draw the graph of \(y=-x^{2}+8 x+1\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant 8\).
(iii) Write down the equation of the line of symmetry of the graph.
(i) On the grid, draw this line for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant 8\).
(ii) Write down the equation of this line in the form \(y=m x+c\).
(b) A straight line has a gradient of \(\frac{1}{2}\) and passes through the point \((2,7)\).
(a) Work out the area of the gardens and the area of the playground.
(i) Show that the grassland area is \(3788.4 \mathrm{~m}^{2}\).
(ii) Show that the grassland area is 3788.4 m .
(iii) Seed for the grassland is sold in bags.
The seed in one bag covers an area of \(280 \mathrm{~m}^{2}\).
The bags cost \(\$ 72\) each for the first 5 bags and then \(\$ 58\) each for any extra bags.
Calculate the cost of the seed needed to cover the grassland.
(b) The park area of \(4620 \mathrm{~m}^{2}\) is made up of paths and grassland. \(18 \%\) of the park area is paths.
(c) The owners of the land buy new equipment for the playground.
They borrow \(\$ 8500\) for 4 years at a rate of \(6.5 \%\) per year compound interest.
Calculate the amount they repay at the end of the 4 years.
Give your answer correct to the nearest dollar.
(d) The caf in the park sells water in bottles \(A, B\) and \(C\).
Work out which bottle is the best value. You must show all your working.
7 The area of some land is in the ratio park:gardens : playground \(= 11:2:3\).
The park has an area of \(4620 \mathrm{~m}^{2}\).
The diagram shows a plan, \(A B C D E\), of the floor of a room in Jo's house. \(F\) is a point inside the room.
9 (a) Sara rides her bicycle at a speed of 420 metres per minute.
Work out her speed in kilometres per hour.
(b) Jan cycles a distance of 51 km .
She has a rest stop for 25 minutes.
Calculate her average speed, in \(\mathrm{km} / \mathrm{h}\), for the time she is cycling.
